scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint

commands.title: Groog go to next find context
Groog go to previous find context
Groog toggle between find and replace input boxes
Find the next selection during recording

args.message: Run alt+shift+f4 to close the window
Run ctrl+shift+q to kill the terminal

groog.typos.description: List of corrections to automatically fix.

items.description: A set of corrections to automatically fix and options on those corrections

breakCharacters.markdownDescription: Break characters for which the typos should be applied. For example, if this is `'- '`, then these corrections will only be applied when the word is followed by a space or hyphen character. This value must be a subset of `#editor.wordSeparators#`. Any characters included here that are not in `#editor.wordSeparators#` will be ignored.

excludeBreakCharacter.markdownDescription: If set to `true`, the break character typed will not be sent to the editor.

languages.markdownDescription: Languages for which the corrections should be applied. If undefined or empty, then the correction is applied to all file types. The `*` character also indicates that these corrections should be applied globally.

replacementSuffix.markdownDescription: A suffix to add after all of the corrections listed in this object. For example, if words is `{'pritn': 'print'}` and this value is `"hello world"`, then typing `pritn ` will result in an auto-correction to `print "hello world"`

replacementSuffixAfterCursor.markdownDescription: This field is similar to `replacementSuffix` except that this field inserts the characters after the cursor

words.markdownDescription: Map of typos to corrected spelling.
